text: The Punjabi Party of Malaysia (, ; abbreviated as PPM) is a Malaysian political party formed in 1986 but only successfully registered in 2003 to represent the interests of Malaysian Indian Punjabi community. It is the only party in Malaysia founded specifically with the interests of Punjabi people in Malaysia as its mission. The party also champion the rights of the Sikh religious belief. Before the fall of Barisan Nasional (BN) in the 2018 general election, PPM was considered pro-BN and had been trying to join the previous governing coalition. ==President== # Jeswant Singh (1986–2002) # Prof. Dato Dr. Gurdeep Perkash Singh (2002–2010) # Susheel Kaur (2010–2013) # Datuk Gurjeet Singh Rhande (23 November 2013 - current) ==See also== *List of political parties in Malaysia *Politics of Malaysia ==References== ==External links== * Official website * Category:Political parties established in 1986 Category:1986 establishments in Malaysia Category:Conservative parties in Malaysia Category:Political parties of minorities Category:Ethnic political parties Category:Identity politics Category:Indian-Malaysian culture Category:Punjabi diaspora in Malaysia
